abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin

sentences.english: Users of popular Twitter-like microblogging service Sina Weibo were likewise disbelieving.

sentences.english: As the highest policymaker of sina, why does Duan Yongji retire from public life suddenly?

sentences.english: Sina said it would issue 47m new ordinary shares to Focus Media shareholders.
sentences.chinese: 新浪表示，将向分众传媒股东增发4700万普通股。

sentences.english: Last October, Hong Hong began to write her story on Sina.

sentences.english: But these failures on Focus Media's part have presented an opportunity for Sina.

sentences.english: Radiohead recently launched a page on the "weibo" site of leading Chinese Internet portal Sina.com.

definition: Sohu, Chinese web portal and online media company
Sina, Chinese web portal and online media company
Sohu, Chinese web portal and online media company
Baidu, Internet portal and search engine, www.baidu.com, listed as BIDU on NASDAQ since 1999
Momo, GPS-based app for messaging, and potentially meeting up with, other Momo users (typically, strangers) in one's vicinity, launched in 2011
Zhihu, Chinese Q&A website modeled on Quora, at zhihu.com, launched in Jan 2011
Toutiao, personalized content recommendation app (abbr. for 今日頭條|今日头条[Jin1 ri4 Tou2 tiao2])
online version of the People's Daily, 人民日報|人民日报[Ren2 min2 Ri4 bao4]
